column1: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) is a mental disorder in which people have unwanted and repeated thoughts, feelings, ideas, sensations (obsessions), or behaviors that drive them to do something (compulsions).
Factors that may play a role include head injury, infections, and abnormal function in certain areas of the brain.
Talk therapy (cognitive behavioral therapy; CBT) has been shown to be effective for this disorder.
For example, constant handwashing can cause skin breakdown.
